activities: Monsanto (and any entity that is owned or controlled by Monsanto Company) processes personal information of prospective, current and former associates and related persons for the following purposes: (1) recruitment and staffing; (2) administration of compensation and benefit programs; (3) time and expense management and other workplace administration, (4) performance management and training, including verification of compliance with corporate policies and procedures; (5) talent management, advancement and succession planning; (6) identity verification and authentication, including system administration and access credentialing, (7) legal compliance and risk management; (8) corporate audit, analysis and consolidated reporting; (9) to protect Monsanto, its workforce, its clients and the public against injury, theft, legal liability, fraud or abuse; and (10) other legal and customary business-related purposes, such as making back-up copies of files for business continuity and disaster recovery, as needed for computer system maintenance and other everyday human resources purposes.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Online and offline personal information pertaining to prospective, current and former employees and other human resources data (such as personal information pertaining to employee dependents and beneficiaries)
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
